Articles.Content:
Hi,

has someone a good Saitec X52 config/Profile which works fine?

Greetings

Gummix

Assuming you are talking about the HOTAS (hands on Throttle and Stick) setup, you can map individual buttons through the settings menu at the main menu. Each player is different so you should map buttons based on your personal preference.
My dream joystick... Alas I only got enough funds to buy Logitech Extreme 3D... Someday...

I agree with Taki117 but if you want to try it here is mine. I mapped the Abort key directly to the Fire button (the one under the cover) within the game.

I also have the new X-55 Rhino which is awesome but unfortunately no longer a single throttle/stick unit when plugged in - you have to plug in two USB cables. This means KSP can't differentiate between them because they use the same axis assignments (for example the 1 axis on the throttle is the same as the 1 axis on the stick and you end up controlling the throttle and pitch at the same time by moving the throttle). This is a Unity limitation I've been told by the devs. Hopefully that gets fixed with an update sometime
For the x 55 cant u use Joy2key or some other program to cpmbine the axis?
ppjoy. It's not supported on Win7 and there's a convoluted way to install it if you really really want to - I'm not that desperate when my X52 works just fine, and in some ways better
